Spark History: Ancient Civilisations takes 10-12-year-olds on a trail of the first civilisations that have shaped humankind. Chapter One introduces the reader to evolution and early human triumphs, from making the first tools to the discovery of fire to the invention of the wheel and use of metal. The author highlights the ways of life and achievements of some of the ancient civilisations and outlines why they faded away.

Along with the colourful unfolding of historical details, interesting facts emerge as one goes from one civilisation to the other.

History is not a mere list of dates; in the pages of this book, the ancient civilisations leap to life through the vivid illustrations and photographs, carefully selected, some appearing here for the first time. Additional information is presented in text boxes, and supporting maps help match early locations with present geographical positions.

Spark History: Ancient Civilisations is an excellent tool for teachers who want to go beyond the textbook and take children on an exciting journey of discovery of ancient civilisations.
